summary: The Courtney Wild Reinforcing Crime Victims’ Rights Act aims to strengthen the rights of crime victims in the federal system. It amends Chapter 237 of Title 18 of the United States Code concerning crime victim’s rights. Key changes include clarifying definitions, expanding victims' rights to be informed about case resolutions, providing for pro bono legal assistance, establishing procedures for addressing government noncompliance, outlining remedies and attorneys' fees, and setting up a process for complaints against government attorneys. The bill also mandates reports to Congress on the Department of Justice's efforts to accord crime victims their rights.
